Physical Exam: Vitals: Checking blood pressure, heart rate, temperature, and breathing rate.
Justification: To assess overall health and identify any abnormalities.

Physical Exam: Auscultation: Listening to your heart and lungs with a stethoscope.
Justification: To listen for any abnormalities in the heart and lungs.

Physical Exam: Palpation: Feeling your abdomen, lymph nodes, and other areas for any abnormalities.
Justification: To feel for any abnormalities in the abdomen, lymph nodes, and other areas.

Physical Exam: Inspection: Visually examining your skin, eyes, ears, nose, throat, and other areas.
Justification: To visually examine the skin, eyes, ears, nose, throat, and other areas for any abnormalities.
